ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about Ancient Greek history and how its art has gone on to influence greatly contemporary society.
- Understanding sculpture, vases, buildings, and monuments!
I learned a lot about ancient greek history, art and architecture.

Incredible course. The class touches on the social and political systems that altered the development of Greek Art and Architecture. Learned a lot about visual analysis and how to really engage with art in person.
History of Greece, Greek Art traditions

This course takes a close look at ancient art history, connecting Greek art with it larger context. It explains pottery, sculpture, painting, and architecture, and although there is extensive preparation needed for exams to remember all this information, it is all very interesting and you learn to communicate about it all with others.
visual analysis
Much greater knowledge of Ancient Greek Art & History

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Prof Gaifman is great and the TAs are kind and patient. The lectures are interesting and the time in the gallery is great.

I loved this class. Professor Gaifman brings a ton of amazing energy and enthusiasm, and the assignments are engaging but not overly harsh. I really appreciated the ability to see objects in the Yale Art Gallery.
Lectures could be a little more organized with images and text but otherwise the class is very interesting! I loved going to the gallery!
Strengths: Professor Gaifman is THE BEST, she is so fun, engaging, and knowledgeable about the topics she discusses. She was well-organized, and the class was always a highlight of my day.
Great course. Well-designed to facilitate learning -- would not change anything!
The course is very engaging through lectures and visits to the YUAG, though could benefit from added sections to further understanding of course expectations.
Strengths: Professor Gaifman and the fabulous TAs, they were entertaining, taught great material and made class fun. No weaknesses

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would. I think its good no matter how much about the content you already know- the TAs and prof will care for you and make sure you get through if you come to class and communicate.
Yes, 100%. The class is well structured, taught with a lot of enthusiasm, and you will learn a lot!
I would! I think that it is a good introduction to Greek art, and it helps you improve your visual analysis skills, especially if you are a beginner.
I would highly recommend this course to anyone in any subject!
Absolutely. One of my favorite classes I have taken and the workload is very manageable. No section, 2 papers, midterm, and final. You barely need to study because class makes you want to learn.
YES! Best course I've taken at Yale. Learnt so much. Actually looked forward to attending lecture -- Professor Gaifman is so engaging.
I would recommend this course to another student and anyone looking to further their knowledge on classical art and its deeper contextual history. Very interesting material.
yes
No
Yes, if you're looking for an easy and relatively interesting 5th class. Much more fun to take this class with friends.

YES! The exams require some memorization but if you go to lecture and put in the work it is very manageable! I thought the content was very well structured and interesting and Professor Gaifman's passion and teaching made the course super engaging!
